r of your

es,

>
> "Regardless, make up your=
 mind?  What will it be, Maximals?  Will you be
> threatening us for every =
single word exchanged and threatening to assault us
> while out of the othe=
r end of your vocalizer saying you need our help?  If
> you wish our assist=
ance, decide what it will be.  That requires you to
> eitehr cooperate with=
 us and make a good show or you can go into the jungle
> on your own."
>
> =
DINOBOT was baiting, attempting to drive a wedge between the MAXIMALS to
> =
either force LEO PRIME to discipline them and undermine his authority, or
>=
 letting them go on which would probably lead to greater and greater tensio=
n
> in the field, and would give the PREDACONS more changes for disruption
=
> should they find a way to abandon the MAXIMALS.  Or to get LEO PRIME to
>=
 admit more of what was going on.
>
> Finally, DINOBOT went to up the escal=
ation, taking over the cue of
> negotiation from HYDRAS.  "And for our coop=
eration in this we have a price.
> A stasis pod with an intact protoform an=
d a spark.  There will be no basis
> for negotiation otherwise.  It would h=
ave been free given  the necessity,b
> ut given your troops have not even e=
ntered the combat zone and are pointing
> fully armed weapons at us and thr=
eatening assault when we have given no
> threat ourselves, there is now a p=
rice for our cooperation.  Since clearly
> we cannot trust Maximal honor fr=
om a leader whom has no qualms about
> permitting his own personal troops t=
o do as they wish and threaten a parlay
> he himself invited.  So, you wish=
 our cooperation, pay our hand for it or go
> in on your own."

<NEW>

Ther=
e was a sound somewhere between a lion=92s roar and a growl that
erupted fr=
om LEO PRIME=92s mouth as he transformed from beast mode back
to his roboti=
c seemingly in midstride.

=93Who is threatening our truce?=94 LEO PRIME sa=
id as he stepped up
towards the group of MAXIMALS and PREDACONS, his optics=
 glancing
across each one.

LEO=92s optics came to a stop on DINOBOT, =93No=
, we will not be giving you
any kind of spark. You and your teammates are i=
n as much danger from
this as we are and we are going to have to pull this =
together if we
are going to make this work we don=92t have time for games.=
=94

Stepping back LEO PRIME gestured at DINOBOT pointing at the path
leadi=
ng away from the group, =93But if you want to leave, you are more
than welc=
ome, but do not come crawling to us with your tail between
your legs later,=
 this is bigger than all of us.=94

=93ALL OF US!=94 LEO said again as he g=
lanced at the others again. His
voice and tone was emphatic, =93But if anyo=
ne wants to stay and try to
work this out, then anyone who tries and break =
this truce they will
answer to *me*=94 LEO was in full command mode, his fa=
ce calm and yet
his tone firm and authoritative no matter who his optics fe=
ll on
MAXIMAL or PREDACON.

Yup, LEO is trying to hold this thing together,=
 even if he did not
agree to it in the first place. Now it was their only s=
hot. DINOBOT
was free to leave as was anyone who chose.

The choice was the=
irs.

(TAG)

Preston
